SENT.plain: Spinocerebellar ataxia type 3, or Machado-Joseph disease, is an autosomal dominant neurodegenerative disease characterized by a wide spectrum of clinical findings that include progressive cerebellar ataxia
All affected individuals have an expanded CAG repeat mutation in one allele of the ATXN3 gene
An inverse relationship exists between the age of onset and the number of repeats in the abnormal expanded allele
The case described is that of a child with Machado-Joseph disease, daughter of a consanguineous affected couple
She inherited the expanded allele in homozygosity with CAG repeat size similar to that of her parents, and had a distinct early onset (4 years of age) and severe clinical phenotype
This case supports the conclusion that homozygosity aggravates the clinical phenotype
Loss of function of the normal expressed ataxin-3, or possibly aggregation of ataxin-3, may be implicated in disease mechanism
